Pengacara Kepala Bapenda Bekasi Klaim Parkir Dijaga Ormas Lahan 'On Street'
07 Nov 2019, 23:48 by Isal Mawardi
Jakarta - RM Purwadi, kuasa hukum dari Kepala Bapenda Bekasi Aan Suhanda, mengklaim lahan parkir yang dijaga ormas berada di tepi jalan atau 'on street'. Padahal dalam surat tugas yang dikeluarkan Aan tertera pungutan retribusi parkir pada titik parkir minimarket yang letaknya di dalam SPBU.
"On street. Kita gunakan adalah parkir on street yang tanpa palang pintu yang disebut dengan retribusi parkir ya, bukan pajak parkir. Pajak parkir yang di dalam yang menggunakan pelang segala macam," ujar Purwadi di Polres Metro Bekasi Kota, Jalan Pramuka, Bekasi Selatan, Kota Bekasi, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Meski kontradiktif dengan surat yang dikeluarkan, Purwadi bersikukuh menyebut surat tugas pemungutan retribusi parkir untuk lahan di pinggir jalan alias on street.
"Prinsipnya, surat tugas itu tidak diberikan kepada yang disebut dengan minimarket. Ini hanya untuk sisi jalan. Kalau untuk minimarket itu kewenangan pengusaha toko kalau memang mereka mau kerja sama dengan mereka ya silakan," ujar Purwadi.
Ketika ditanya apakah praktik di lapangan telah menyalahi surat tugas, Purwadi mengelak.
"Oh tidak, surat tugasnya sudah benar kalau soal ada oknum yang menyalahi ketentuan tugas saya ya nggak tahu," ujar Purwadi.

Head of Lawyers for Bapenda Bekasi Claims Parking is Guarded by 'On Street' Land Organizations
Nov 7 2019, 23:48 by Isal Mawardi
Jakarta - RM Purwadi, attorney from Bekasi Bapenda Head Aan Suhanda, claimed that the parking lot that was guarded by mass organizations was on the side of the road or 'on street'. Whereas in the letter of assignment issued by Aan, a parking fee was levied at the convenience store's parking point which was located inside the gas station.
"On street. We use parking on the street without a doorstop called parking fees, not parking taxes. Parking taxes inside that use all kinds of customers," Purwadi said at Bekasi City Metro Police, Jalan Pramuka, South Bekasi. , City of Bekasi, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Although contradictory to the letter issued, Purwadi insisted that the duty to collect parking fees for land on the roadside, aka on street.
"In principle, the assignment letter is not given to the so-called minimarket. This is only for the side of the road. For the minimarket, the authority of the shopkeepers is if they want to cooperate with them, go ahead," Purwadi said.
When asked whether the practice in the field violated the assignment letter, Purwadi dodged it.
"Oh no, the assignment letter is correct if there is a person who violates the terms of my assignment, I don't know," Purwadi said.
